sentences.en: A bit of gunpowder, sulphur, and potassium chlorate in a tin.
sentences.cn: 把一点火药, 硫磺, 氯酸钾放到罐子里。

sentences.en: A smell of gunpowder penetrated the woods.
China invented gunpowder thousands of years ago.
sentences.cn: 中国几千年前发明了火药.

sentences.en: Daniel: Gunpowder, compass the paper making, and the printing.
sentences.cn: 丹尼尔: 火药 、 指南针、造纸术和印刷术.

sentences.en: Gunpowder is composed of sulfur, carbon, and potassium nitrate.
sentences.cn: 火药是由硫 、 碳和硝酸钾组成.

sentences.en: Gunpowder was introduced into Europe during the first half of the 14 th century.
sentences.cn: 在14世纪上半叶,火药传入欧洲.

sentences.en: Gunpowder was the lineal successor of the Greek fire.
sentences.cn: 火药是希腊火的直接衍生物.

sentences.en: Gunpowder was used in China as far back as the 11 th century.
sentences.cn: 远在公元11世纪,中国已使用火药.

sentences.en: Sulphur is a constituent of gunpowder.
Tests show that these fireworks are made of locally produced gunpowder.
sentences.cn: 这些炮竹经检验是由土药制成的.

sentences.en: The Chinese anticipated the European discovery of gunpowder.
sentences.cn: 中国人在欧洲人之前发明了火药.

sentences.en: The discovery of gunpowder is usually referred to China.
sentences.cn: 火药的发明通常归功于中国.

sentences.en: The origins of gunpowder in China also date from the 9 th century AD.
sentences.cn: 火药在中国也是起源于9世纪.

sentences.en: With the advent of gunpowder, Musketeers became the mainstay of European armies.
sentences.cn: 由于火药的出现, 持枪步兵成为欧洲军队的支柱.

trans.tran_cn: 火药，有烟火药，黑色火药，中国珠茶
trans.tran_en: an explosive substance used in bombs and  fireworks
